brand.name: Laura Siegel Collection
brand.ethicalInfo1: Laura Siegel collaborates with artisans from around the world to create easy-to-wear, luxurious pieces
brand.ethicalInfo2:
Laura Siegel Collection's environmental rating is 'good'. It uses a proportion of environmentally-friendly materials including repurposed sari's and Tencel, but also uses a proportion of non environmentally friendly materials including conventional cotton. It uses some vegetables-based dyes but does not mention a policy on chemical use for other products. It reduces its carbon footprint by hand-manufacturing all of its products. It does not mention any water reducing initiatives.

Its labor rating is 'good'. It works with mostly artisanal groups around the world and states it pays them a living wage, however, it does not mention or provide a Code of Conduct. It traces suppliers in most of its supply chain, including raw materials (first stage) and its final stage of production. It visits its suppliers but does not mention how often. One of its aims is to create positive labor conditions and it collaborates with organizations to ensure workers receive mentorship and training.

Its animal rating is 'it's a start'. It uses leather and wool without specifying its sources as well as alpaca. It does not use fur, down, angora, or any other exotic animal skin or hair.

Laura Siegel Collection is rated 'Good' based on information from our own research.
brand.positiveText: Dear Laura Siegel Collection, I love the style and features of your products, and also that you care about people, the planet and animals. Good On You!
brand.negativeText: Dear Laura Siegel Collection, I love the style and features of your products, but I'm concerned about the impact of your brand on workers, the environment and animals. Until you do better I'll be looking for alternative brands that meet my needs.
